sentences: Kael on kaela taga ja kael ees.
Tal oli valu kaelas p채rast treeningut.
context: The Estonian word 'kael' primarily means 'neck', referring to the part of the body connecting the head and torso. It can also sometimes refer to 'throat' in certain contexts, though 'kurg' is more commonly used for throat specifically. The word is a common noun in Estonian and follows normal grammatical rules with different cases like 'kaela' (genitive) and 'kaelal' (locative).
